availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, steamboat captain, merchant, and hotel keeper. Louisville, Kentucky, native. Married to Margaret Telon Miller. Father of Lillie Miller, Mary Miller, and Jennie Miller. Steamboat captain on the Ohio River and Mississippi River between Louisville, Kentucky, and New Orleans, Louisiana. Owned the Robert J. Ward in partnership with Phillip King and George King. Merchant in Louisville in 1858. Owned and operated the Galt House hotel in Louisville from the early 1859 to 1864. Operated the Burnet House in Cincinnati, Ohio, in 1865.

ab.bibl:

"Ferguson, Mary Johnson," Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 697.
Louisville City Directory & Business Mirror for 1858-9," (Louisville, 1858), 123.
"Wanted to Hire," _Louisville Daily Journal, (Louisville, Kentucky), December 23, 1859, p. 2.
Williams' Cincinnati Directory, 1865 (Cincinnati: Williams & Co., 1865), 292.
